content: puddle/yolky slime crochet pattern written by deadfawn notes this is a free pattern do not try to sell this document for money feel free to do whatever you want with completed items made with the pattern though if you d like to make a yolky slime follow the color changes if not work in solid blue the pattern is on pages 1-2 and finished photos are at the end of this document on pages 3-5 materials - #4 medium weight yarn worsted/aran in blue for the puddle slime or in yellow light yellow and white for the yolky slime - g-6 - 4 00mm hook - 8mm safety eyes - yarn needle optional for weaving in ends you can use a small hook to hide ends as well - a small amount of stuffing glossary magic_ring - magic_ring/circle single_crochet - single_crochet increase - increase 2 single_crochet in one stitch decrease - decrease turning 2 single_crochet into 1 single_crochet flo - front loop only cc - color change pattern puddle only make 1 in blue yolky only start in yellow round 1 single_crochet 6 in magic_ring or chain 2 and single_crochet 6 in 2nd chain from hook 6 round 2 increase 6 12 round 3 single_crochet increase *6 18 round 4-5 single_crochet around for a total of 2 rnds 18 yolky only cc to light yellow round 6 single_crochet around 18 at this point i like to insert the eyes i insert them between rnds 4-5 with about 4 stitches in between yolky only cc to white 1 you can work round 7 in flo if you want a sharper angle in the transition from top to bottom i recommend this for the yolky slime especially round 7 single_crochet 2 increase *6 24 round 8 single_crochet 3 increase *6 30 round 9 single_crochet 4 increase *6 36 round 10 single_crochet 5 increase *6 42 round 11 single_crochet around 42 round 12 single_crochet 5 decrease *6 36 round 13 single_crochet 4 decrease *6 30 round 14 single_crochet 3 decrease *6 24 round 15 single_crochet 2 decrease *6 18 i find this a good point to stuff it put a small ball of polyfill in the head/top but be careful not to put too much stuffing in the flat part or it will puff up round 16 single_crochet decrease *6 12 round 17 decrease 6 6 fasten_off weaving the end through the last 6 decrease and pulling tightly to close it shut and then tucking the tail inside 2 finished pictures 3 4 thank you to my pattern tester @shigella on ravelry here is her final yolky slime 5
